post_text:
Labor Day, celebrated on the first Monday of every September, honors millions of hardworking Americans across the country. It’s a day in which the U.S. Department of Labor pays tribute to the "greatest worker in the world". This year goes without exception. We'd like to honor all our teachers, aides, office employees, classified staff, support staff, administrators, and we cannot forget our parents for their hard work.

Although no one is certain who first proposed the national holiday, observed since 1887, it’s come to be known as the end of the summer event and the start of back-to-school season. We hope you all are able to take a moment to truly enjoy the three-day weekend with one last BBQ!

post_text:
SO GOOD TO SEE YOU!!!
These first-day-of-school pictures are sure to bring a smile to your face! Thank you to proud father for submitting these photos. It's wonderful to see our kiddos!

We are so proud our students and staff for their great attitudes as we start the 2020-21 school year online.

First days of school pictures may still be submitted through Wesnesday, September 2nd, for consideration of possible posts to PUSD social media.

Email photos to Ashley.marroquin@parlierunified.org in their original file size (largest format) and include parent's name, student's name, grade level and school. (Names will not be used in digital media.)

post_text:
Parlier Unified School District Board of Trustees announced at last night’s regular meeting in a unanimous vote that Altagracia “Gracie” Guerrero, Ed.D. has been appointed as the new Superintendent of Schools for Parlier Unified School District. After an extensive search process, the Board selected Dr. Guerrero for her broad and established instructional leadership roles, strength in collaboration and focus on increasing student learning and achievement. Dr. Guerrero will begin her new assignment immediately.

Join us in welcoming our new superintendent to Parlier Unified School District!
text:
Parlier Unified School District Board of Trustees announced at last night’s regular meeting in a unanimous vote that Altagracia “Gracie” Guerrero, Ed.D. has been appointed as the new Superintendent of Schools for Parlier Unified School District. After an extensive search process, the Board selected Dr. Guerrero for her broad and established instructional leadership roles, strength in collaboration and focus on increasing student learning and achievement. Dr. Guerrero will begin her new assignment immediately.

Join us in welcoming our new superintendent to Parlier Unified School District!

post_text:
Welcome to 2020-21 Cohort B!

As we plan for a beginning like no other we have seen in the past, our focus will still be to ensure that:

every child, every day is finding a way to feel connected,

every child, every day is being challenged by new learnings and experiences,

and every child, every day knows they have a champion they can turn to.

post_text:
School is back in session...that is for Cohort A! Welcome back students! We missed you!

The school year may be starting online, but we know our families will be taking their traditional first-day-of-school pictures! We'd love to see them. If you'd like to share your first-day photos for possible publication in the district's social media, email them to ashley.marroquin@parlierunified.org. Please send original or largest size photo available. Be sure to include your name, your child's name, grade level and school.

Things may look different, but we know as we work together, we will make it a great!

post_text:
A HUGE congratulations goes out to Mrs. Caufield, Mrs. Leija and ALL the staff of John C. Martinez Elementary School for being awarded the 2020 California Positive Behavioral Interventions and Supports (PBIS) Community Cares State recognition for "their outstanding contribution of support and care during the unprecedented COVID-19 pandemic"!!! They submitted an application and artifacts that successfully demonstrated that they went above and beyond to provide support to our students during these challenging times. We are so proud of them!!!

Please see the attached letter with more details about this prestigious award.

Great job Jaguars and very well deserved!!!

Thank you students and families who participated in the 1st - 8th grade PUSD Summer School program. July 16th marked the official last day of Summer School. However, students who participated in the 1st - 8th grade PUSD Summer School program may continue to login to Edgenuity and myOn through July 31st. We encourage you to continue to take advantage of all the resources and opportunities that Parlier Unified has to offer and wish your child continued success in their academic journey.

As a reminder, July 16th was also the final day for summer grab and go meal distribution. This service will be paused until further notice. If you have any questions or concerns regarding the Grab and Go meals, please contact the Food Service office at (559) 646-7115.

post_text: Cesar E. Chavez Pre-School is now accepting applications for the 2020-2021 school year. To enroll your child he/she must be 4 years old by September 1st. The application will be done online. Please log onto parlierunified.org and register under Cesar E. Chavez School. Mrs. Adame will be on campus on June 30th to answer any questions you may have. If you need assistance during the month of July, please call Mrs. Adame at 559-646-3595. Mrs. Adame will return back to school on August 3rd.

post_text: Online registration for Kindergarten and Transitional Kindergarten for the 2020-2021 school year is still available! To enroll your child to kindergarten he/she must be 5 years of age by September 1, 2020. To enroll your child to Transitional Kinder they must be 5 years old between September 2, 2020 and December 2, 2020. We also offer dual immersion programs. To register your child you will need the following items: proof of address (for example, a utility bill, mortgage statement, rental agreement, rental receipt, correspondence from state or county), parent ID, you child's birth certificate, physical, and immunizations (which include 5 doses of diphtheria, tetanus, and pertussis, 4 doses of polio, 3 doses of hepatitis B, 2 doses of measles, mumps, and rubella, 2 doses of varicella, and TB testing). You can register online by visiting our website www.parlierunified.org or calling us at 559.242.6836.

Registration begins Thursday, June 11th at Benavidez Elementary School from 4:00 PM - 6:00 PM and again on Friday, June 12th at Chavez Elementary School from 4:00 PM - 6:00 PM. If you have any questions or concerns feel free to contact 559.646.2963 or 559.646.3595.

We will continue Grab and Go Meal Services to children through July 17th. Grab and Go Meals are available to children 18 and under and include breakfast, lunch and dinner with heating instructions for dinner.

Grab and Go Meals will continue to be distributed Mondays, Wednesdays, and Thursdays from 10:00 AM - 12:00 PM at Martinez & Benavidez Elementary Schools Bus Loading Zones, from 10:00 AM - 11:00 AM at Chavez Elementary School Bus Loading Zone, from 10:00 AM - 10:45 AM at the Salandini Villa Apartments (a PUSD mini school bus will be parked in front of the leasing office), and from 11:00 AM - 11:45 AM at the Migrant Camp entrance (at the designated school bus stop). Distribution at school sites will require you to exit your vehicle to pick up meals at the cafeteria.

If you have any questions or concerns regarding the Grab and Go meals, please contact the Food Service office at (559) 646-7115.

post_text:
This information is being provided to you on behalf of the California Department of Social Services.

Pandemic EBT, or P-EBT, is a new benefit for families that usually receive free and reduced-price school meals, CalFresh, CalWORKS, Medi-Cal, and/or other social services. This is a program funded by the California Department of Social Services and is completely separate from the Grab-n-Go meals Parlier Unified School District is distributing. Families that qualify for free or reduced-price school meals may get up to $365 per child in state benefits to buy food. The application is easy. Apply today at ca.p-ebt.org and you should receive your benefits within 10 days. Families who have already received a Pandemic EBT (P-EBT) card in the mail do not need to apply. If you have questions regarding this program, please contact your local CalFresh, CalWorks, Medi-Cal office or the California Department of Social Services.

post_text:
Monday, May 25th, is a holiday, the District Office will be closed. We will return to regular business hours on Tuesday, May 26th.

Have a safe and happy Memorial Day weekend!

Did you know?

Each year on Memorial Day a national moment of remembrance takes place at 3:00 p.m. local time.

It is unclear where exactly this tradition originated; numerous different communities may have independently initiated the memorial gatherings. And some records show that one of the earliest Memorial Day commemoration was organized by a group of freed slaves in Charleston, South Carolina less than a month after the Confederacy surrendered in 1865. Nevertheless, in 1966 the federal government declared Waterloo, New York, the official birthplace of Memorial Day.

And some records show that one of the earliest Memorial Day commemoration was organized by a group of freed slaves in Charleston, South Carolina less than a month after the Confederacy surrendered in 1865. Nevertheless, in 1966 the federal government declared Waterloo, New York, the official birthplace of Memorial Day.

We are still offering children 18 and under Grab and Go Meals, which include breakfast, lunch and dinner with heating instructions for dinner. However, the distribution sites have slightly changed.

Grab and Go Meals will be distributed Mondays, Wednesdays, and Thursdays:

From 10:00 AM - 12:00 PM at Martinez & Benavidez Elementary Schools Bus Loading Zones

From 10:00 AM - 11:00 AM at Chavez Elementary Schools Bus Loading Zones

From 10:00 AM - 10:45 AM at the Salandini Villa Apartments (a PUSD mini school bus will be parked in front of the leasing office)

From 11:00 AM - 11:45 AM at the Migrant Camp entrance (at the designated school bus stop).

Distribution at school sites will require you to exit your vehicle to pick up meals at the cafeteria.

Please note, due to this upcoming Monday being a holiday, we will pause Grab and Go Meal Services to students. They will resume on Wednesday, May 27th.

If you have any questions or concerns regarding the Grab and Go meals, please contact the Food Service office at (559) 646-7115.

post_text:
May 17-23, 2020 is California Classified School Week!

Please join us this week in saying “thank you” to our classified staff; men and women who serve our schools, support our staff, and take care of our students.

This year has been especially challenging for all of us, and in these difficult times we are more thankful than ever for the contributions and efforts of our classified staff throughout the district.

Our effectiveness and the success of our students is in large part dependent upon these dedicated individuals.

We appreciate and look forward to seeing all of you back on school sites supporting our students and fellow staff!

THANK YOU!!!

From the Parlier Unified Administration

post_text: Online registration for Kindergarten and Transitional Kindergarten for the 2020-2021 school year begins May 11, 2020! To enroll your child to kindergarten he/she must be 5 years of age by September 1, 2020. To enroll your child to Transitional Kinder they must be 5 years old between September 2, 2020 and December 2, 2020. We also offer dual immersion programs. To register your child you will need the following items: proof of address (for example, a utility bill, mortgage statement, rental agreement, rental receipt, correspondence from state or county), parent ID, you child's birth certificate, physical, and immunizations (which include 5 doses of diphtheria, tetanus, and pertussis, 4 doses of polio, 3 doses of hepatitis B, 2 doses of measles, mumps, and rubella, 2 doses of varicella, and TB testing). You can register online by visiting our website www.parlierunified.org or calling us at 559.242.6836.
text: Online registration for Kindergarten and Transitional Kindergarten for the 2020-2021 school year begins May 11, 2020! To enroll your child to kindergarten he/she must be 5 years of age by September 1, 2020. To enroll your child to Transitional Kinder they must be 5 years old between September 2, 2020 and December 2, 2020. We also offer dual immersion programs. To register your child you will need the following items: proof of address (for example, a utility bill, mortgage statement, rental agreement, rental receipt, correspondence from state or county), parent ID, you child's birth certificate, physical, and immunizations (which include 5 doses of diphtheria, tetanus, and pertussis, 4 doses of polio, 3 doses of hepatitis B, 2 doses of measles, mumps, and rubella, 2 doses of varicella, and TB testing). You can register online by visiting our website www.parlierunified.org or calling us at 559.242.6836.

post_text:
MAY IS MENTAL HEALTH AWARENESS MONTH

We'd like to take the time to remind you...

Be Kind to Your Mind
Tips to cope with stress during COVID-19

1 PAUSE. Breathe. Notice how you feel
2 TAKE BREAKS from COVID-19 content
3 MAKE TIME to sleep and exercise
4 REACH OUT and stay connected
5 SEEK HELP if overwhelmed or unsafe

Visit our Student Support Service page for more resources!

https://www.parlierunified.org/apps/pages/index.jsp?uREC_ID=1208232&type=d&pREC_ID=1464727

post_text:
Thanks to the work of the Parlier Youth Coalition, under the guidance of the California Health Collaborative R, the City of Parlier recently passed a Tobacco and Vape-Free Parks policy. The students from Parlier High School in the Youth Coalition worked hard to make this possible for the safety of everyone in our community. We are very proud that our students led this effort!

Attached are the newsletters in English and Spanish with more information about this initiative.

post_text:
Attention Parents & Students:
During the Stay-at-Home order, School Mental Health services will continue. The District has implemented a temporary School Telehealth Program to accommodate students while they are at home.

We will follow up with you during our regularly scheduled hours: 8:00 AM – 4:30 PM.

If this a life-threatening emergency please call 911 or go to your nearest emergency room.

NEED CRISIS SUPPORT?

If you or your child needs someone to talk to during difficult times, make a call or send a text to:
• National Suicide Prevention Lifeline: 1-800-273-8225
• NAMI HelpLine: 1-800-950-NAMI (6264) or email info@nami.org
• Crisis Text Line: Text NAMI to 741-741

LINK to ADDITIONAL SOCIAL EMOTIONAL SUPPORTS:
https://www.parlierunified.org/apps/pages/index.jsp?uREC_ID=1208232&type=d&pREC_ID=1860435

Tonight's Board Meeting will be held at 6:00 p.m. at John C. Martinez Elementary School. To abide by the social distancing guidelines the Library will be the designated room for any English speaking member(s) of the public, Room 5 will be the designated room for any Spanish speaking member(s) of the public, and the cafeteria will remain the main board meeting room. No more than 10 individuals will be allowed in each room at any one time pursuant to guidance from public health officials.

---

La reunión de la Junta de Mesa para esta noche se llevará a cabo a las 6:00 p.m. en la escuela primaria John C. Martinez. Para cumplir con las pautas de distanciamiento social, la Biblioteca será la sala designada para cualquier miembro del público que hable inglés, la Sala 5 será la sala designada para cualquier miembro del público que hable español, y la cafetería permanecerá la sala de junta principal. No se permitirán más de 10 personas en cada sala a la vez de acuerdo con la guia de los funcionarios de salud pública.

Device pick up starts today! Please refer to the schedule posted on our website and social media. Save yourself some time and complete the technology agreement. You can download the form on our website under Latest News “Urgent Message - COVID-19 Information” and scroll all the way to the bottom. If you cannot download it, copies will be available at your school or the district office. Make sure to bring your own pen for your own safety!

If you already have technology issued to you or have your own personal technology, you do not have to go to your school.

PUSD IS TAKING CARE OF OUR COMMUNITY

During the temporary closure of our schools through April 3, free meals for anyone 18 and under are available M - F from 10:00 a.m. to 12:00 p.m. at Brletic Elementary and Benavidez Elementary Bus Loading Zones.

Staff was happy to see many families stopping by to pick up grab-and-go breakfasts and lunches.

Please help us spread the word!

post_text:
Parlier Unified School District is committed to ensuring the safety of all students. There is no report of any students or staff being diagnosed with the Coronavirus COVID-19. Nevertheless, Parlier Unified School District will be taking additional precautionary measures and the Parlier High School and Mathew J. Brletic Elementary School campuses will be closed to students and staff for the remainder of this week. Parlier Unified staff will perform a thorough and deep cleaning of all surfaces in all rooms and buildings at Parlier High School and Mathew J. Brletic Elementary School to further ensure the health and safety of all students.

Classes will resume on Monday, March 16th.

Thank you for your cooperation.

Brletic Elementary School campuses will be closed to students and staff for the remainder of this week. Parlier Unified staff will perform a thorough and deep cleaning of all surfaces in all rooms and buildings at Parlier High School and Mathew J. Brletic Elementary School to further ensure the health and safety of all students.

Classes will resume on Monday, March 16th.

Thank you for your cooperation.

post_text: Ballots are in! Measure D was one of the bond measures on the March 3rd ballot and it passed with 61.63% of voters voting YES for Measure D! This $11 million general obligation bond program will address the needs of the student population through modernization and renovation projects at the District’s seven schools. We’d like to thank our community for voting YES on Measure D!
text: Ballots are in! Measure D was one of the bond measures on the March 3rd ballot and it passed with 61.63% of voters voting YES for Measure D! This $11 million general obligation bond program will address the needs of the student population through modernization and renovation projects at the District’s seven schools. We’d like to thank our community for voting YES on Measure D!

SAVE THE DATE: March 7

The job fair will take place at the Swan Court Conference Center, located in the Spike N Rail Restaurant adjacent to the Selma Holiday Inn (2910 Pea Soup Anderson Blvd. Selma, CA 93662). The event begins at 9:00 AM, with registration and teacher interviews starting at 9:30 AM and ending at 12:00 PM.

Positions are available in all grades and all subjects! Participating Districts will be interviewing teacher candidates and offering contracts.

For more information contact:

post_text:
Love was definitely in the air this month! Our very own CWA superheroes paid a visit to our Parlier Senior Center on Valentine's Day. Our superheroes were able to help with art projects, converse and share stories of a loved one on how they remember growing up in Parlier and then danced the afternoon away. It was a great way to give back to our seniors and a great reminder that they are valuable to our community!

If you see these students around, please give them a shout out for a job well done:

Ricardo Ayala
Summer Bell
Katlyn Morfin
Jonathan Rangel
Ivan Sanchez
Nayeli Valdovinos
Aaliyah Duran

post_text: On Saturday, February 22nd, 53 Parlier High School students competed in various career technical education categories at the Annual Region 2 Skills USA event. We’re very proud to share that 20 Parlier students qualified to proceed to the State Skills USA Competition, which will take place in Ontario, CA on April 16-19, 2020. Out of the 20 students who are proceeding to the State Contest, 8 received medals. Additionally, whoever places 1st or 2nd place at the State Convention will qualify to proceed to the Skills USA National Competition. It is because of the efforts our students, staff and educational partners that our school district has reached the Blue Level, which is the highest possible level for College and Career Readiness on the CA Accountability Dashboard did two consecutive years. Congratulations again to all our students who participated!
text: On Saturday, February 22nd, 53 Parlier High School students competed in various career technical education categories at the Annual Region 2 Skills USA event. Out of the 20 students who are proceeding to the State Contest, 8 received medals. Additionally, whoever places 1st or 2nd place at the State Convention will qualify to proceed to the Skills USA National Competition. It is because of the efforts our students, staff and educational partners that our school district has reached the Blue Level, which is the highest possible level for College and Career Readiness on the CA Accountability Dashboard did two consecutive years. Congratulations again to all our students who participated!

post_text: We’d like to acknowledge our athletes for the hard work they put in this winter season. If you’d like to show your support and appreciation, we invite you to attend Parlier High School’s Award Ceremony this coming Tuesday, March 3rd at 6:00 p.m. at the North Gym.

TUE, MAR 3
PHS Award Ceremony
text:
We’d like to acknowledge our athletes for the hard work they put in this winter season. If you’d like to show your support and appreciation, we invite you to attend Parlier High School’s Award Ceremony this coming Tuesday, March 3rd at 6:00 p.m. at the North Gym.

TUE, MAR 3
PHS Award Ceremony

post_text:
Parlier Unified is on a Foggy Day schedule Plan "A" (2 hour delay) this morning. To get the most current updates, you may check with KMTF Channel 18 TV, the PUSD website, Facebook, Instagram, or Twitter accounts (@parlierusd), or download the “Foggy Day valleypbs” app on your smartphone.

When a foggy day schedule is implemented school will start on time; however, you may keep your children home while a foggy day plan is in effect if you have no means to safely transport your own child. Tardiness and absence because of fog or inclement weather will be excused upon parent notification.
